    Climbing

    Essential gear and tips for safe and rewarding climbing adventures.

    üßó Core Gear

    • Harness ‚Äì Comfortable fit with secure buckles.
    • Helmet ‚Äì Protects against falling rocks and bumps.
    • Climbing shoes ‚Äì Sticky rubber soles for grip and precision.
    • Belay device ‚Äì Essential for controlled descents and partner safety.

    ü™¢ Ropes & Protection

    • Dynamic ropes ‚Äì Stretch to absorb falls.
    • Static ropes ‚Äì Ideal for abseiling or hauling gear.
    • Carabiners ‚Äì Locking and non-locking for different uses.
    • Quickdraws ‚Äì Connect rope to bolts or gear placements.

    üèîÔ∏è Trad & Sport Extras

    • Cams & nuts ‚Äì For traditional protection in cracks.
    • Chalk bag ‚Äì Keep hands dry for better grip.
    • Clip stick ‚Äì Helpful for reaching high bolts safely.
    • Anchor systems ‚Äì Build secure belays at the top.

    üß≠ Safety & Training

    • First aid kit ‚Äì Compact but essential.
    • Guidebooks or apps ‚Äì Know routes and grades before you climb.
    • Training grips ‚Äì Build finger strength at home.
    • Communication plan ‚Äì Always let someone know your route.

    üõ†Ô∏è Nice-to-Have Extras

    • Approach shoes ‚Äì Comfortable for hiking to crags.
    • Portable hangboard ‚Äì Train on the go.
    • Lightweight backpack ‚Äì Carry gear without strain.
    • Action camera ‚Äì Capture climbs from unique angles.

    üí¨ Common Mistakes (We‚Äôve Made Them Too)

    • Misjudging rope length for a route
    • Skipping helmet use on ‚Äúeasy‚Äù climbs
